[caption id="attachment_176304" align="alignleft" width="375" caption="Captain Zlatko Glusica lived for family and the sky. With grandson.  By courtesy: Merima Glisca "][/caption]Six months after Mangalore Air Crash claimed 158 lives Indian Court of Inquiry  (CoI)  blamed Serbian pilot Zlatko Glusica for the country’s worst air disaster in last decade.  

According to Hindustan Times,  the captain Glusica “ was asleep for over 1 hour 40 minutes of the three-hour flight and "disoriented" at the time when the plane started to descend. 

Indian anonymous source stated that Glusica was suffering from “ sleep inertia”  adding that “black box” recorded “ heavy nasal snoring and breathing in pilot cabin”. 

According to voice recorder the copilot H. S Ahluwalia, warned the captain repeatedly to "abort landing" saying they didn't have enough runway left and thrice asked him to "go around" 

Serbian media accepted “sleepy pilot” story as a the final version of this tragically event not showing much interest to investigate real background of Mangalore disaster.  It painfully affected the pilot's close family, friends and colleagues  who live in Serbia. 

His daughter Merima Glusica says to “ Global Voice” :



 “ Horrible headlines were published  in Serbian media. One of them, „ Zlatko Glusica killed 158“ completely broke me  afterward my little son asked whether uncle Alexandar also perish one day if he continues to fly.


Zlatko’s son Alexandar is a student of Flight Academy and his pilot's training was the main reason why mr Glusica signed contract with Air India where minimal monthly pilot’s payment is about 9.500$. In same time Serbian pilot's average salary in national airline JAT Airways is about 2,400 euros. 

Deeply hurted Alexandar directed a protest note to Serbian daily Blic requsting them:



 " It’s inhuman is to deal with rumors about the guilt of my father while the official results of the investigation are still unknown. Do not blame my father till end of investigation" 

He explains to Global Voice:



 “ The accusations against my father and the allegations of his responsibility for the deaths of 158, without any official and reliable facts  are a crime! ... I understand that a country like India blames foreigner not confessing the own error an
